content.description: A classic KY start from a tree. Get yourself on the rock and climb the wide hand crack. Rap a tree.
content.location: Move left after the tunnel to the crack behind a tree.Â  Begin on the tree trunk.

climbs.name: Supercrack (aka Crack Attack)
climbs.fa: Ed Pearsall, Kevin Pogue, and others, June 1982

content.description: Scramble up to the ledge where this beautiful splitter crack begins. Push past the low roof with tight hands and prepare for one of the best handcracks in the red. Jam for the next 60 feet in the parallel sided crack until you hit the fist and offwidth section but its short lived. Clip the anchors and remind your self that you are in the Red.
content.protection: Multiple Camming units in the hand size and a fist size. This crack doesn't vary much in size so bring at least 4 #2 camalots or equivilent to stretch it thin.
content.location: Walk towards the Fibrulator and pass it staying along the wall. The next line you come across will be Crack Attack. (37.893898, -83.636811)

content.description: An all-around pleasant climb.  Jam, stem, and jug haul your way through a pleasant crack climb for 60 feet until you reach a few seemingly intimidating roof/ledges.  Ignore the instinct to bury your head in the crack and identify good feet that are all around.  Proceed on up to where the crack flares and choose between equally good chimney and stemming options.  Sling a couple trees and enjoy a great view.
content.protection:
The crack will take thin/finger-sized gear deep-in toward the bottom of the route.  This gets harder to find as you go up and there are many good fist-sized placements.  Bring some #2 Camalots and plenty of #3s.  Don't ignore the horizontals, as there is also some good gear outside the crack.  Big pro (#4-#6 Camalots) is helpful for the wide section at the top.  Two of #5 or #6 is great here, but one piece will get you through and add a little excitement.

After you exit the wide section and pass a dead-looking tree on your left, there is a medium-sized tree ahead and 15 feet above this, a larger tree at the top-out.  A 70m rope will get you down from the larger tree on top.
content.location: Follow the approach trail and head right after a large boulder on your right.  Don't bother scrambling up here, it's much easier to walk around.  Proceed a few hundred feet along the wall to locate this right-facing dihedral.  When you're at the route, there will be a good-sized open cave to your right.

content.description: The wide crack on climber's right side of the pinnacle. Rap from a summit sling.
content.location: Right side of the pinnacle.

content.description: A lesson in not following instructions. Work your way to a bulge, and into a handcrack angling up through some greenery. Rap a tree.
content.location: From "Bring out the Gent", walk left past 2 green cracks to a 3rd green crack.

climbs.name: Over Easy
climbs.fa: Chuck Keller, Steve Faulkner, Jim Bailey, Dave Wilson, 1988.

content.description: Not the best route, but a goof warmup for Jims if you're here. Follow a chossy crack to a roof. Move up and left. Find a ledge. Escape this chaos by going down through a chimney to the start of Blood on the Nuts.
content.location: Between the Great Beyond and Jim's.

content.description: Follow a finger crack and some moderate face climbing to a ledge. Locate a fixed but and a belay. Continue up the wide crack to the top. Rap a tree to descend.
content.location:
Located around the corner from

Break the Edge

.

HARD TO FIND.

content.description: Absolute classic for the area. Start on a boulder, move across to a ledge and and stick your fingers in and go. After a few moves, the rock gets better and the climbing gets harder. At the top of the finger crack, keep goin' up via some spicy face moves to the top. Rap a tree.
content.location: Start on the boulder left of "All in a Day's Work.

content.description: Locate the roof with an offwidth goin' through the middle. Under the roof and slightly left is a short finger crack in blackened rock, with a small ledge halfway up. Step up to the crack and boulder to the small ledge. Continue up through a handcrack to a larger ledge.
content.location: Left of Better Red.

content.description: Find the bulge, and send the cracks up to it. Work right to the ledge. Lower on gear.
content.location: 75 feet left of the Crack Attack is a rockhouse and ledge at 60 ft.

content.description: Obvious, nice looking offwidth line in a dihedral. Follow it to the top. Large gear advised. Rap a tree.
content.protection: Standard Rack plus a few extra big pieces.
content.location:
Just right of

Orange Barrel.

content.description: Climb the obvious corner through a short dirty section at the bottom.  Negotiate through the wide start into the handcrack above and puzzle through the interesting finish to top out.
content.protection: Many hand size cams make this route G rated.  Save a purple and green Camalot for the topout.
content.location:
Obvious dihedral a few hundred feet before you get to

Supercrack (aka Crack Attack)

.  Seriously, if you can't find this perfect corner go back to Roadside.

content.description: Straight in hand crack.
content.location: From the pinnacle, go left until you see a huge hueco near the top of the cliff. Climb the crack that is on the right side of the hueco. Enter the hueco. Rap fixed gear.

content.description:
Head up the the wide hand crack 30 ft. right of

Six Four Face.

Rap summit slings.
content.location: Right of Six Four Face. Far right side of Pinnacle.

content.description: Follow the clean offwidth to the top of the cliff. Rap a tree.
content.location: From "Shit my Pants", walk left. Takes a minute to get there.

content.description: There are 2 hand cracks here. This is the right one. Chimney up to the left until it ends. Make some spicy face moves to top out.
content.location: Just right of Fribulator and Jims.

content.description: A small crack system to a shelf
content.location: Just to the right of slimy creatures

climbs.name: G2 the Friction
climbs.fa: Chuck Keller, Steve Faulkner, Tim Schlachter, 1991

content.description: Right facing offwidth just off the ground. Follow the crack till it isn't a crack anymore. Wander right to a pine, left to a crack, and fire to the top. Runout at spots.
content.location: Right of Gizmo.

content.description: Follow the crack system between Jim's and Over Easy.
content.location: Between Jim's and Over Easy.

content.description: It's a line, I guess. Dirty.
content.location: The unattractive, well vegetated line right of Blissoming.

content.description:
Don't go right. Work the boulder right up and over the roof. Bring small gear for the crux. More direct, better protected, and just a

little harder

than the OG Classic.
content.protection: Standard Rack. Bring a #00 metolius or Black Alien for the crux.
content.location: Fibrulator 11b start.

content.description: Two cracks here. This is the left one. Follow the line to the roof, then move left. Pull a lip up to another ledge. Move right to a rap tree.
content.location: Right of Better Red. Left of 2 cracks.

content.description:
Climb easy ground to the roof and get as high as you can to get some gear in the roof. Step back down and right to a slab and climb straight up to a heady move and step left back into the crack. Throw in some gear and enjoy the finger and hand crack up to a small ledge. Get it back and finger lock up the last portion to the bolted anchor.

The direct version which is straight up the roof goes at 11d
content.protection: finger and a few hand pieces and a grey metolius or black alien for the roof
content.location: Climbers right of the approach along the wall 5 minutes. The obvious splitter finger crack all the way up the face.

content.description: Obvious dihedral with a roof 40-ft up. Work hand sized hames to a ledge. Fire the offwidth roof up through to the top.
content.location: Left of Fribulator. Find the offwidth.

content.description: The right of two hand cracks several hundred feet right of Curiosity. Rap a tree.
content.location:
Several Hundred feet right of

Curiosity.

content.description: Obvious, mossy, left-facing dihedral with a maple tree growing in front of it. Climb up.
content.location:
From

Another one Bites the Dust

, Hike along the cliff past where it turns right and continue for a few hundred feet.

content.description: 60-ft left of the line to the right. Find the hueco and follow the right-angled crack into it. Rap the hueco on fixed gear.
content.location: 60 ft. left of the "It's got it all"

content.description: A great warmup for the area. A clear, clean crack that takes pro well.
content.location: From the rock pillar, head left to the next buttress over. Hike up a weakness between the main wall and the buttress to the most obvious hand crack on the right, just past a pile of boulders.

content.description: work up armbars to a ledge and set up a belay. Throw a hand-fist stack in the roof and throwyour legs up into the chimney. Work your way up the beast upside down and figure out how your going to get upright, there is a small crimp to assist you. Armbar your way up the heinous chimney and crawl out the hole at the top for the summit.
content.location: Walk to the climbers right of the wall and look for the large chimney offwidth roof crack.

content.description: Another ledge belay a la the climb to the left. Follow good hands to a finger crux. Pull a ledge and rap slings. May be old.
content.location: The crack on the left side of of the dihedral from Crack Attack.

content.description: Wide crack in the main corner just left of Dangling Angle. Chimney up, out, and back in. Rap a tree.
content.location: Wide crack in the main corner just left of Dangling Angle.

climbs.name: Blood on the Nuts
climbs.fa: Chuck Keller, Jim Bailey, Steve Faulkner, Dave Foster, Dave Wilson, 1988

content.description: Head left from "Country Lovin'" around the corner and then scramble up the gully to a small roof with a crack. Climb the crack to the roof, traverse left on the face, then continue up the corner and improvise a finish!
content.protection: Protects well with #1-#3 BD's.  Bring a couple of each.
content.location: There are two cracks at the base of the route, underneath the roof.  Start with the crack on the right. Make the move over the roof, and back into the crack. Rappel down from tree at the top.

content.description: A clear offwidth working off of Trunkline. Work through the bulge and into a chimney up to the top. Rap a tree.
content.location: In the corner with Trunkline.

content.description: Left of a pair of short hand cracks. Jam to a ledge and rap a tree.
content.location:
Several hundred feet right of

Curiosity.

content.description:
The kind of route which elicits the response, "What is THAT thing?" as most 20+ foot offwidth roofs do. A must do for those interested in hard wide climbing. Considering how little traffic this route gets, it's a wonder it isn't totally overgrown (unlike the 5.8 approach pitch).

Climb either Not Ice or a dirty/loose 5.8 crack to the left of it and belay right below the roof. Proceed through handstacks and kickthroughs, finishing with a strenuous pivot into the chimney.
content.protection: Two bolt belay, could be backed up with .75 and 1 camalots. The crack itself takes a 2 camalot, with doubles of 4, 5, and 6.
content.location: 50 yards right of Slimy Creatures  is an enormous roof with a big crack in it. You can't miss it!

content.description: Jam to a roof. Work right through an offwidth and crank the lip. Belay on a ledge just below a rap tree. Continue up a chimney then take either of 2 cracks to the top. Rap a tree.
content.location: Crack just right of Don't Come Easy.

climbs.name: All in a Day's Work
climbs.fa: Ben Faber, Joseffa Meir, Eric Kampel, 1997.

content.description: A wide crack sunk into a dihedral. Work your way through awkward moves. Rap a tree.
content.protection: Standard Rack plus a few extra Large Cams.
content.location: Immediately left of Gumby.

content.description: Find the wide crack on climbers-left of the pinnacle. Rap a tree midway or top top out and rap.
content.location: This route is on the separated pinnacle rather than the main wall. Turn right after the approach split.
